name: places/ChIJI14LUPj3wokR1el5XENxo0c
formattedAddress: 2308 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10030, USA
adrFormatAddress: 2308 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10030-2614, USA

originalText.text: I went and ordered tacos and they gave me (3) double layer corn flour tacos stuffed with lettuce, cheese, onions and tomatoes. The meat was all the way at the bottom, literally a teaspoon worth of oxtails for $22. Looked nothing like what they advertised! The waiter even noticed it and immediately tried to help but all the cook did was remove the lettuce and added more cheese and french dressing. I didn’t bother to complain because I didn’t expect them to satisfy me by the looks of thing. Besides that, the hookah was actually good, I was impressed and the music was great too. The drinks was not worth it so I ended up having to go to the liquor store next door right after. I might try again in Never-ary!

originalText.text: Came here with a couple of my friends on a Friday night. The drinks were good. The music was good and the service was good. However, when it came to food, that's where they fell flat. It took over 40 minutes for our food to come out and not to mention but other customers received their food before we did. After 40 minutes, the waitress came over and told my friend they only had small pieces of calamari that was at the bottom of the bag and asked her if she still wanted it. My friend said no and chose to get the buffalo wings instead. After almost an hour, our food comes out and the jerk wings I ordered were cold and the size of pigeon wings. The jerk chicken empanadas would have been good had there been chicken in it. All you tasted was crust and cheese and they gave you jerk sauce on the side. My friend's baffalo wings came out just when myself and our other friend was done eating. If you're looking for a place to have a drink and listen to good music then this is the place for you. Order food at your own risk and only if you're willing to wait almost an hour for it.

originalText.text: Hidden gem with great vibes the atmosphere is very inviting. The owner is very sweet made sure my friends and I were comfortable. The food was amazing! I cannot get over the braised oxtail and the coconut rice and peas!!! The bartender was awesome the drinks were PERFECT!! I had a couple of drinks and by far the best lemon drop I had was from here! I will definitely return!!!!

text.text: Hidden gem with great vibes the atmosphere is very inviting. The owner is very sweet made sure my friends and I were comfortable. The food was amazing! I cannot get over the braised oxtail and the coconut rice and peas!!! The bartender was awesome the drinks were PERFECT!! I had a couple of drinks and by far the best lemon drop I had was from here! I will definitely return!!!!

originalText.text:
I went to the restaurant this past Wednesday around 4pm with a friend. Walked in bartender informed us the waitress was not in yet and to sit where we wanted. We decided to have the bartender who by the way was the sweetest person ever take our order. Looked at the menu and decided to order and almost everything we order was not available. Appetizer: No Calamari or Ackee and Saltfish. Ok lets do Entree. Entree: No stew chicken, no escovitch fish (sigh). Side order: No white rice again (sigh). I mean why are you even open then. Frozen machine for drinks was not working either ( No frozen Hennesy). Ordered oxtail tacos ( oxtail meat was cold and the tortilla was cold). Entree ordered jerk chicken. Chicken leg was pink and luke warm, cabbage was cold and only the rice was hot as if thats the only part of the food they microwaved. Curry Shrimp entree came in a little skillet in which the skillet was cold. It was like they just decided to dump the shrimp in it without actually heating the skillet up. Again the cabbage was cold and the vegetable rice temperature wise was luke warm. After the meal we were told the calamri was ready and if we wanted it we declined. The bartender again who waa sweet said she will provide it for free because of our experience but we declined. The food was mediocre and I only came here due to what I saw on Instagram thinking this place would be it. It was not.
On another note a young lady walked in with this red and blonde wig, which I assumed was the waitress with her bubble jacket on. She was behind the bar with her jacket and pink purse. Then i saw her make herself a drink in what looked like a Champagne flute and she drank that drink by the bar. How unprofessional. I watched her the whole time i was there since me and my friend was the only one there besides one gentleman at the bar until we were almost done then 3 ladiea walked in. The waitress looked like she was only there for her drinks. Thank goodness we were serve by the bartender. To sum it all up I would not be returning. I had better tasting food at my local Jamaican restaurant.

originalText.text: The ambiance is nice there food is excellent.  Their oxtail tacos and entrees are to die for.  I can't get enough!!  The bartenders are great and Karaoke Tuesdays are sooooo much fun!!
